metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32308 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in uBlock Origin extension before1.41.1 allows remote attackers to run arbitrary code via a spoofed'MessageSender.url' to the browser renderer process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

webext-ublock-origin-chromium - 1.42.0+dfsg-1
webext-ublock-origin-firefox - 1.42.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ublock-origin package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.42.0+dfsg-1').
